subject: Is it possible to use an IoC framework inside junit testcase?
msgSnippet: Hi, dear all I m wondering if JUnit has some standard way to integrate with an IoC framework. I have several kinds of testcases for Vehicle and its descendant.
messageBody:
Hi, dear all

I'm wondering if JUnit has some standard way to integrate with an IoC
framework.

I have several kinds of testcases for Vehicle and its descendant.
These testcases are very general so it can be used to truck, car, and
moto. So I wrote down following testcase:

@RunWith(Parameterized.class)
public class VehicleTest{
@Parameters
public static Collection<Object[]> sets() {
List<Object[]> args = new ArrayList<Object[]>();

args.add(Truck.class);
args.add(Car.class);
args.add(Moto.class);

return args;
}

final Vehicle vehicle;
VehicleTest(Class vehicleClass){
vehicle = vehicleClass.newInstance();
}

@Test
testRun(){
....
}
}

The I stopped here. The difficult thing for me is "I need to specify
different attributes to different vehicles". I can do it in the
contructor VehicleTest(Class) with help of "instanceof". But it looks
rather ugly. Shall I used some standard IoC framework such as Spring
to help me setup the testcase? Or is there better way to implement my
vehicle samples?
